H0.text: Speed is indicated by the color of a star.

H1.text: Volume is indicated by the color of a star.

H2.text: Distance is indicated by a star's color.

H3.text: Temperature is indicated by the color of a star.

A4.text: Modern observational versions of the chart replace spectral type by a color index (in diagrams made in the middle of the 20th Century, most often the B-V color) of the stars.

A5.text: The spectral type is not a numerical quantity, but the sequence of spectral types is a monotonic series that reflects the stellar surface temperature.
